It is only after all the stages of the preparation, mounting, assembly and openwork have been completed that the gem-setting itself can begin. Once the precious metal has been prepared by the jeweler, the gem-setter hand places the gemstones in their structure. The art of the gem-setter is to place the stone in the best position to enhance its shine and leave as little metal as possible.
